channel.title: Animation tut for starters/ deathknight platebody release
channel.description:
Well I decided to make the animation tut For a platebody, since I couldn’t find a tut that is understandable for beginners, other than cj’s but it was missing some really important information. i feel like if people know how to animate. they would start putting some more effort into their model so i will look badass ingame, and raise the level of performance in this section So lets get right into it.
Difficulty: 5 [url=http://uppit.com/CHP31K-]http://uppit.com/CHP31K-[/url] master palette
You will need: metasequoia, datemaker, masterpalette.mqo, and the ability to focus because animating is easy but its annoying if you mess it up.
To start, Open masterpalette.mqo and then insert your model into it. ([b]You have to start with masterpalette.mqo I can’t stress that enough. If you don’t if will mess up your animation and sometimes even your model[/b].) Clone your model three times. It should look like this. [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/insert.png[/img] [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/0e37f9a2.png[/img] [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/2-7.png[/img] ( what the master palette looks like)
Now on the first clone rename it [b]PRI:[/b] in caps. Second clone is [b]TSKIN:[/b] and the last clone is [b]VSKIN1:[/b] Now to get to the animation. [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/1-7.png[/img]
Now make only the [b]PRI:[/b] model visible. Select the plate’s body (no arms included) and select 3 in the material box. now scroll up to the selected button on the top toolbar and hit set material to faces. Now your plate’s body should be a golden yellow color. Now select the arms of the models. Select 10 in the material box, and set the arms faces to 10. So it is a water blue color. And that it for the PRI: model [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/PRI.png[/img] [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/setting.png[/img]
Now deselect it, and select[b] TSKIN:[/b] Now select the plate’s body like before and set it to 4 in the material box. For the arms follow CJ’s guide at the bottom.(plus that will be less typing for me ) [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/TSKIN.png[/img]
With that done deselect the TSKIN: model and select [b]VSKIN1:[/b] (you have to do the part carefully because this is the actually movement animtions. If its done wrong the plates animation ingame will be screwed up). there is no changing of the faces in the vskin1. so it will look identical to your original model.
Now select the plate’s body Go to the commands toolbar and select wgt. It should look like this. [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/wgt.png[/img]
Set the body’s wgt to 0.04 The left shoulder is 0.21 right shoulder is 0.25 Left upper arm is 0.17 right upper arm is 0.23 Left lower arm is 0.19 right lower arm is 0.22 Refer to this. [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/items.png[/img]
Now thats done make all the models visible. Then save as whatever. Make sure you don’t his save or it will overwrite the masterpalette file. View it in datmaker and convert it. it should look like this when you click false colors [img]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/1-6.png[/img]
Now for other pieces of armor use cj’s guide now that you know what everything is. [b]BTW dont delete any faces on one of the models unless you do it for all of them. they can be moved around but not deleted if you do delete it then you will get an error in datmaker and it can screw your model up. [/b]
[IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/ingame4.png[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/ingame3.png[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/ingame2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/ingame1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/3-7.png[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/1-6.png[/img] [IMG]http://i652.photobucket.com/albums/uu248/poopler3/2-6.png[/img]
credits [i]10% SilentCJ for his pic from the guide 5% djoscar for his guide to raise polylimit (Awsome) 85% me for making and putting it all together.[/i]
[b]if you have a questions post it and i will reply as soon as i can[/b] Enjoy

item.title: Animation tut for starters/ deathknight platebody release
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

it explains exactly how its done if you read hur dur.

Could you show me where? The link he provided is also broken.

3.5 - Manually Animating Using Metasequoia

Manually animating using metasequoia will enable you to add any type of model, that moves.
This is extremely helpful because when Runescape updated to HD, a lot of their models, had corrupted animation data, therefore it doesn’t move/work in game.
But this is also helpful for adding custom armour and weapons to your client with no glitches.

Okay, firstly, follow MrPotatoHead’s tutorials, at here.

http://datmaker.dragonscape.info
Full credits to MrPotatoHead. You own.

Follow the whole tutorial, in the tutorial you will need to add some values to parts of your models.
Here are some basic templates for all parts of the body.
Damn this took a long time.

Firstly.

Helmets/Heads

Platebodies/Bodies

Arms

Platelegs/Legs

Boots/Feet

Gloves/Hands

Capes

Shields

Weapons (Sword based)

Amulets/Necklaces

LEFT UNFINISED, will finish at a later date.

Read full topic
